snippet: Since the late 1930s, men of Chinatown have been playing nine-man, their own intense and dynamic variation of volleyball, in the streets, alleys and parking lots.
abstract: Summer on the eastern edge of Manhattan's Chinatown has never been about sand and sun; since the late 1930s, men have been playing nine-man, their own intense and dynamic variation of volleyball, in the streets, alleys and parking lots; game features nine players per side and has turned into cult sport played by Americans and Canadians of Chinese descent celebrating grit of their roots (Series: Summer In...).
lead_paragraph: Since the late 1930s, men of Chinatown have been playing nine-man, their own intense and dynamic variation of volleyball, in the streets, alleys and parking lots.

headline.main: Rogue Sport Lacks Sand but Has Style and Speed
headline.print_headline: Rogue Sport Lacks Sand but Has Style and Speed
